alert.note: Alert for Butler; Preble; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A RAPIDLY DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN PREBLE, CENTRAL BUTLER AND NORTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 551 PM EDT, a rapidly developing thunderstorm was located near Darrtown, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Oxford, Monroe, Trenton, Franklin, South Middletown, Camden, Seven Mile, Williamsdale, Darrtown, New Miami, Somerville, West Elkton, Jacksonburg, Hughes, Collinsville, Maustown and Beckett Ridge. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 33 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
